at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs

Class CarApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.ict.andropicar.rmcs.CarApplication

  • public class CarApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the RMCSs (Racecar-Mobility-Control-System) main class, where all needed classes are being instantiated and corresponding threads are started.
    It also processes all the control-change-events (via putting an element on the controlChangeQueue) and updates all connections in connections.
    A set of arguments can be entered upon start, which is processed by processArguments(java.lang.String[]).
    Author:
    Boeck

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private long carId
      The cars ID that is used to register on the Server.
      private RMCSComponentManager carInterfaceManager
      The object that handles all of the cars different hardware modules.

      The list of all Connections.

      The LinkedBlockingQueue where all requests to change control are put.

      The object that handles all GamepadConnections.

      The servers default IP-address

      The object that handles the SPI-connection to the STM32.

      The UI that displays all relevant information.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void initialize(java.lang.String[] args)
      The method where all needed classes are being instantiated and corresponding threads are started.
      If the RMCS does not have sensors, it will not try to establish a UART-connection with the STM32-board, hence there will not be an instance of STM32UartInterface.
      If the RMCS does have sensors, there will be an instance of STM32UartInterface which will lead to the inability to use the bluetooth module and the RMCS will not be able to be controlled by a PS3-gamepad.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args) 
      private boolean processArguments(java.lang.String[] args)
      A set of arguments can be entered upon start, which will be processed by this method.
      A list of possible arguments can be shown by starting the application with the help-flag (-h or --help).
      private void processControlChangeQueueElement(ControlChangeQueueElement controlChangeQueueElement)
      Processes all the control-change-events (via putting an element on the controlChangeQueue) and updates all connections in connections.
      If the id of passed ControlChangeQueueElement exceeds the size of connections or equals -1, the first GamepadConnection is set as the controlling device.
      void run(java.lang.String[] args)
      Starts the RMCS.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize(java.lang.String[] args)
        The method where all needed classes are being instantiated and corresponding threads are started.
        If the RMCS does not have sensors, it will not try to establish a UART-connection with the STM32-board, hence there will not be an instance of STM32UartInterface.
        If the RMCS does have sensors, there will be an instance of STM32UartInterface which will lead to the inability to use the bluetooth module and the RMCS will not be able to be controlled by a PS3-gamepad.
        Parameters:
        args - the list of arguments that were passed upon starting the RMCS.

      • processArguments

        private boolean processArguments(java.lang.String[] args)
        A set of arguments can be entered upon start, which will be processed by this method.
        A list of possible arguments can be shown by starting the application with the help-flag (-h or --help).
        Parameters:
        args - the list of Strings that are passed along upon application-start.
        Returns:
        true, if the RMCS has sensors, otherwise false.

      • processControlChangeQueueElement

        private void processControlChangeQueueElement(ControlChangeQueueElement controlChangeQueueElement)
        Processes all the control-change-events (via putting an element on the controlChangeQueue) and updates all connections in connections.
        If the id of passed ControlChangeQueueElement exceeds the size of connections or equals -1, the first GamepadConnection is set as the controlling device. If no gamepad is connected to the RMCS, the phone will be set as the controlling device.
        Parameters:
        controlChangeQueueElement - contains the next ControlChangeQueueElement to be processed

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts the RMCS.
        Parameters:
        args - the list of Strings that are passed along upon application-start

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
